required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/Ritonavir - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in France
clinical_study.official_title: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C - An Observational Study in France

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to determine the effectiveness of the interferon-free ABBVIE REGIMEN ± ribavirin (RBV) in participants with chronic hepatitis C (CHC) virus in clinical practices across France.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR12)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 20, 24, or 36 depending on the treatment regimen)
primary_outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug. Participants with missing HCV RNA were counted as virological failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Virological Response at End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sufficient Follow-up Who Achieved Sustained Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 20, 24, or 36 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug. The Core Population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR12 included all core population participants who had evaluable HCV RNA data ≥ 70 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN or a HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline or had HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline, but no HCV RNA measurement ≥ 70 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN due to reasons related to safety (e.g. dropped out due to adverse event) or virologic failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen) and up to 24 weeks after the end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Relapse was defined as participants with a virologic response (VR; HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL) at end of treatment (EOT) followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL at any time after the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Breakthrough
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8, 12, or 24 weeks (depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: Breakthrough was defined as at least one documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL during treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Rapid Virological Response at Week 4 (RVR4)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: RVR 4 was defined as participants with HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at week 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sufficient Follow-up Who Achieved Sustained Virological Response 24 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 32, 36, or 48 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug. The Core population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR24 included all core population participants who had evaluable HCV RNA data ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN or a HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline or had HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline, but no HCV RNA measurement ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN due to reasons related to safety (e.g. dropped out due to adverse event) or virologic failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in Each Non-response Category 12 Weeks Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 20, 24, or 36 depending on the treatment regimen)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to the ABBVIE Regimen, by Adherence Category
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 8 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen.
secondary_outcome.description: Adherence to the ABBVIE treatment regimen is expressed as a percentage of the target dose and was calculated as: Cumulative dose taken / (initial prescribed dose * planned duration) * 100 The ABBVIE regimen consists of paritaprevir/r and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to Ribavirin by Adherence Category
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 8 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen.
secondary_outcome.description: Adherence to ribavirin is expressed as a percentage of the target dose, and was calculated as: Cumulative dose taken / (initial prescribed dose * planned duration) * 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Ribavirin Treatment Days in Relation to the Target Number of Ribavirin Treatment Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 8 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Received Concomitant Medications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 8 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen
secondary_outcome.description: Concomitant medication other than for chronic hepatitis C used from the time when the decision was made to initiate treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir until after the last dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events, Serious Adverse Events, or Pregnancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug through 30 days after last dose (12 to 28 weeks depending on treatment regimen). The median (minimum, maximum) duration of treatment was 84 (4, 167) days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Impact Scale Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Fatigue Impact Scale (FIS) questionnaire was used to assess the impact of fatigue on the quality of life of patients. The FIS consists of 40 items, each of which is scored 0 (no problem) to 4 (extreme problem), providing a total score from of 0 to 160, where a lower score = less fatigue impact

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) Index Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). Responses to the 5 dimension scores were combined and converted into a single preference-weighted health utility index score by applying country-specific weights.The range for EQ-5D-5L index score is 0 to 1 where '0' is defined as a health state equivalent to being dead and '1' is full health.The higher the score the better the health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) VAS Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status with a separate visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS assesses overall health on a scale from 0 (worst health imaginable) to 100 (best health imaginable).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Absenteeism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Absenteeism indicates the percentage of work time missed due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Presenteeism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Presenteeism indicates the percentage of impairment while working due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Work Productivity Impairment (TWP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment (TWP) indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Activity Impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment (TAI) indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Beliefs Medication Questionnaire - (18-item BMQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: The BMQ consists of 2 sections and 18 questions to screen for patients' beliefs, attitudes and concerns about their medication. The BMQ-Specific section comprises two 5-item subscales assessing the necessity of and concerns about the prescribed medication (Specific-Necessity and Specific-Concerns). The BMQ-General section comprises two 4-item subscales assessing beliefs that medicines are harmful and overused by doctors in general (General-Harm and General-Overuse). The 18 items are rated on a Likert scale from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree). Each subscale score ranges from 1 to 5. High scores in the Specific-Concerns scale represent the notion that adverse reactions are potentially harmful when taking medication on a regular basis, and high scores in the Specific-Necessity scale indicate the patient's need to adhere to medication to maintain health. High scores in the General-Harm and General-Overuse scales represent an overall negative perception of medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient Activation Measure 13 (PAM-13)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: PAM 13 is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management, consisting of 13 questions. Each of the 13 items can be answered with one of four possible response options, which are "disagree strongly" (1), "disagree" (2), "agree" (3), "agree strongly" (4). Scores were summed to calculate the overall raw score, then transformed to a scale with a theoretical range 0 to 100, based on calibration tables, with higher PAM scores indicating higher patient activation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Outpatient Consultations Due to Liver Disease by Category
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug through 30 days after last dose (12 to 28 weeks depending on treatment regimen). The median (minimum, maximum) duration of treatment was 84 (4, 167) days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hospitalizations Due to Liver Disease by Category
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug through 30 days after last dose (12 to 28 weeks depending on treatment regimen). The median (minimum, maximum) duration of treatment was 84 (4, 167) days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percent Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)

arm_group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease. The prescription of treatment regimen was at the discretion of the physician in accordance with local clinical practice and label, and was made independently from this observational study and preceded the decision to offer the patient the opportunity to participate in this study.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients chronically infected with HCV, receiving the interferon-free ABBVIE REGIMEN, were offered the opportunity to participate in this study during a routine clinical visit at the participating sites.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC, genotype 1 or 4
- Participants receiving or who will receive the interferon-free ABBVIE REGIMEN ± RBV according to product label
- RBV prescribed in line with the current local label
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant is not participating or intending to participate in a concurrent interventional therapeutic trial

facility.name: CHR Orleans - Hopital de la Source /ID# 147250

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This observational study was conducted in 69 medical centers in France experienced in the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC). The first participant entered the study on 15 December 2015, last patient last visit was on 29 March 2018.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease. The prescription of treatment regimen was at the discretion of the physician in accordance with local clinical practice and label, and was made independently from this observational study and preceded the decision to offer the patient the opportunity to participate in this study.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Years Since Diagnosis of HCV Infection
HCV Genotype
Cirrhosis Status
Pretreatment Status
HCV RNA Concentration
measure.population: The core population included all enrolled participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype).

measure.title: Assigned Treatment Regimen
measure.description: Treatment regimen was assigned by the physician according to local practice and label. Participants could receive two (paritaprevir/ritonavir and ombitasvir) or three (paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir) direct-acting antiviral (DAA) drugs with or without ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks.

measure.title: Co-morbidities
Drug Users

outcome.population: The Core population includes enrolled participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype).

outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug. The Core Population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR12 included all core population participants who had evaluable HCV RNA data ≥ 70 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN or a HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline or had HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline, but no HCV RNA measurement ≥ 70 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN due to reasons related to safety (e.g. dropped out due to adverse event) or virologic failure.

outcome.population: The Core population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR12

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Sufficient Follow-up Who Achieved Sustained Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-treatment
measure.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug. The Core Population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR12 included all core population participants who had evaluable HCV RNA data ≥ 70 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN or a HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline or had HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline, but no HCV RNA measurement ≥ 70 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN due to reasons related to safety (e.g. dropped out due to adverse event) or virologic failure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Relapse
outcome.description: Relapse was defined as participants with a virologic response (VR; HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL) at end of treatment (EOT) followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL at any time after the end of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen) and up to 24 weeks after the end of treatment.
outcome.population: The Core population with VR at EOT, who completed treatment, and had ≥ 1 HCV RNA measurement ≥ 70 days post-treatment or were a treatment failure between EOT and day 70.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.description: Relapse was defined as participants with a virologic response (VR; HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL) at end of treatment (EOT) followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL at any time after the end of treatment.
measure.population: The Core population with VR at EOT, who completed treatment, and had ≥ 1 HCV RNA measurement ≥ 70 days post-treatment or were a treatment failure between EOT and day 70.

outcome.description: Breakthrough was defined as at least one documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL during treatment.
outcome.time_frame: 8, 12, or 24 weeks (depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population with virological response on-treatment and with at least one on-treatment measurement thereafter (including EOT).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to the ABBVIE Regimen, by Adherence Category
measure.description: Adherence to the ABBVIE treatment regimen is expressed as a percentage of the target dose and was calculated as: Cumulative dose taken / (initial prescribed dose * planned duration) * 100 The ABBVIE regimen consists of paritaprevir/r and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir.

outcome.population: Core population who were prescribed ribavirin

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to Ribavirin by Adherence Category
measure.description: Adherence to ribavirin is expressed as a percentage of the target dose, and was calculated as: Cumulative dose taken / (initial prescribed dose * planned duration) * 100
measure.population: Core population who were prescribed ribavirin

outcome.title: Percentage of Ribavirin Treatment Days in Relation to the Target Number of Ribavirin Treatment Days
outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 8 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen.
outcome.population: Core population who were prescribed ribavirin and with non-missing data

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Percentage of Ribavirin Treatment Days in Relation to the Target Number of Ribavirin Treatment Days
measure.population: Core population who were prescribed ribavirin and with non-missing data

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Received Concomitant Medications
outcome.description: Concomitant medication other than for chronic hepatitis C used from the time when the decision was made to initiate treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir until after the last dose.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 8 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen
outcome.population: All treated participants

outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug through 30 days after last dose (12 to 28 weeks depending on treatment regimen). The median (minimum, maximum) duration of treatment was 84 (4, 167) days.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events, Serious Adverse Events, or Pregnancies
measure.population: All treated participants

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Impact Scale Total Score
outcome.description: The Fatigue Impact Scale (FIS) questionnaire was used to assess the impact of fatigue on the quality of life of patients. The FIS consists of 40 items, each of which is scored 0 (no problem) to 4 (extreme problem), providing a total score from of 0 to 160, where a lower score = less fatigue impact
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: Core population with non-missing data at baseline and each time point

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Impact Scale Total Score
measure.description: The Fatigue Impact Scale (FIS) questionnaire was used to assess the impact of fatigue on the quality of life of patients. The FIS consists of 40 items, each of which is scored 0 (no problem) to 4 (extreme problem), providing a total score from of 0 to 160, where a lower score = less fatigue impact
measure.population: Core population with non-missing data at baseline and each time point

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) Index Score
outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). Responses to the 5 dimension scores were combined and converted into a single preference-weighted health utility index score by applying country-specific weights.The range for EQ-5D-5L index score is 0 to 1 where '0' is defined as a health state equivalent to being dead and '1' is full health.The higher the score the better the health status.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) Index Score
measure.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). Responses to the 5 dimension scores were combined and converted into a single preference-weighted health utility index score by applying country-specific weights.The range for EQ-5D-5L index score is 0 to 1 where '0' is defined as a health state equivalent to being dead and '1' is full health.The higher the score the better the health status.
measure.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) VAS Score
outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status with a separate visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS assesses overall health on a scale from 0 (worst health imaginable) to 100 (best health imaginable).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) VAS Score
measure.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status with a separate visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS assesses overall health on a scale from 0 (worst health imaginable) to 100 (best health imaginable).
measure.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Absenteeism
outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Absenteeism indicates the percentage of work time missed due to health problems.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: The Core population who were employed and with available data at baseline and each time point.

Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment (TWP) indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.

measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Activity Impairment
outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment (TAI) indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Activity Impairment
measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment (TAI) indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.
measure.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Beliefs Medication Questionnaire - (18-item BMQ)
outcome.description: The BMQ consists of 2 sections and 18 questions to screen for patients' beliefs, attitudes and concerns about their medication. The BMQ-Specific section comprises two 5-item subscales assessing the necessity of and concerns about the prescribed medication (Specific-Necessity and Specific-Concerns). The BMQ-General section comprises two 4-item subscales assessing beliefs that medicines are harmful and overused by doctors in general (General-Harm and General-Overuse). The 18 items are rated on a Likert scale from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree). Each subscale score ranges from 1 to 5. High scores in the Specific-Concerns scale represent the notion that adverse reactions are potentially harmful when taking medication on a regular basis, and high scores in the Specific-Necessity scale indicate the patient's need to adhere to medication to maintain health. High scores in the General-Harm and General-Overuse scales represent an overall negative perception of medication.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and end of treatment.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 8, 12, or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Beliefs Medication Questionnaire - (18-item BMQ)
measure.description: The BMQ consists of 2 sections and 18 questions to screen for patients' beliefs, attitudes and concerns about their medication. The BMQ-Specific section comprises two 5-item subscales assessing the necessity of and concerns about the prescribed medication (Specific-Necessity and Specific-Concerns). The BMQ-General section comprises two 4-item subscales assessing beliefs that medicines are harmful and overused by doctors in general (General-Harm and General-Overuse). The 18 items are rated on a Likert scale from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree). Each subscale score ranges from 1 to 5. High scores in the Specific-Concerns scale represent the notion that adverse reactions are potentially harmful when taking medication on a regular basis, and high scores in the Specific-Necessity scale indicate the patient's need to adhere to medication to maintain health. High scores in the General-Harm and General-Overuse scales represent an overall negative perception of medication.
measure.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and end of treatment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Patient Activation Measure 13 (PAM-13)
outcome.description: PAM 13 is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management, consisting of 13 questions. Each of the 13 items can be answered with one of four possible response options, which are "disagree strongly" (1), "disagree" (2), "agree" (3), "agree strongly" (4). Scores were summed to calculate the overall raw score, then transformed to a scale with a theoretical range 0 to 100, based on calibration tables, with higher PAM scores indicating higher patient activation.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (week 8, 12, or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and end of treatment.

Each of the 13 items can be answered with one of four possible response options, which are "disagree strongly" (1), "disagree" (2), "agree" (3), "agree strongly" (4). Scores were summed to calculate the overall raw score, then transformed to a scale with a theoretical range 0 to 100, based on calibration tables, with higher PAM scores indicating higher patient activation.
measure.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and end of treatment.

reported_events.time_frame: Deaths are reported up to 24 weeks after end of treatment (a maximum of 48 weeks). Adverse events are reported from first dose of study drug through 30 days after last dose (12 to 28 weeks depending on treatment regimen). The median (minimum, maximum) duration of treatment was 84 (4, 167) days.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir Without RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir and ombitasvir without ribavirin for either 12 weeks.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir With RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir and ombitasvir with ribavirin for either 12 weeks.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir Without RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir without ribavirin for 8 or 12 weeks.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir With RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir with ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: AbbVie requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. AbbVie requests that no presentation/publication will be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if AbbVie needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.
